name: tasty-treats-dont-miss-the-rest-of-nashvilles-restaurant-week
title: Tasty Treats: Don’t Miss The Rest Of Nashville’s Restaurant Week
author: Morgan Levy
contentEncoded:
Hey, it’s Restaurant Week! The wonderful week where nearly forty Nashville Originals restaurants have special prix fixe menu offerings, priced between $2.11 and $30.11 (most fall in the $20.11-30.11 range). Restaurant Week started on Monday the 5th, but you have through Sunday the 11th to sample the delights of Nashville’s finest local eateries.

Whether you start small at Drinkhaus with a $2.11 specialty coffee drink, snag a two-course lunch at Fish & Co. for $10.11 or go all-out with the $30.11 three-course dinner (paired with three wines for an additional $15.05) at Midtown Cafe, Restaurant Week gives you the opportunity to branch out and try something new without breaking the bank. Participating restaurants include a bunch of old favorites and a handful of new: 55 South, Bound’ry, Cabana, Caffe Nonna, Cha Chah, Copper Kettle, Crow’s Nest, DrinkHaus, Fido, Fish & Co., Flyte, F. Scott’s, Germantown Café, Goten, Holland House, Jimmy Kelly’s, The Listening Room Café, MafiaOza’s, Mambu, Midtown Café, Nero’s Grill, Noshville Midtown, Green Hills and Cool Springs, The Pineapple Room at Cheekwood, PM, Provence Hillsboro Village and Downtown, Puckett’s Franklin and Nashville, Red Pony, Rumba, Rumours East, SOL, Sunset Grill, Suzy Wong’s House of Yum, Tayst, Tin Angel, Watermark, Wild Iris and The Yellow Porch.

Check out all of the menus here, and don’t forget to make a reservation, because they fill up fast! We’re excited by all of the lunch options this time around – PM, Fido, Caffe Nonna, Copper Kettle, The Listening Room, Noshville and The Pineapple Room are all running $20.11 lunch-for-two specials, and the aforementioned Fish & Co. bargain is calling our names. What Restaurant Week stops are you planning to make?

Photo by Thomas Hawk.
